text: so what's your very favorite
collaboration tool and I'm referring to
the various Technologies we use to
communicate with our colleagues at work
if you have a hard time answering that
question I get it because there are so
many collaboration tools and the options
just keep growing but just because a
tool seems like the latest or greatest
does that mean we have to use it Paul
Leonardi a professor at the University
of California at Santa Barbara says no
on average people spend $84 minutes a
day looking for the information they
need to get their work done uh they
spend about 30 minutes per day deciding
what digital tools they should use for a
specific task and they spend almost an
hour a day switching between different
tools what that suggests to me is that
we have a overabundance of different
communication and digital Technologies
in our workplace and what the research
shows is that too much choice is always
demot motivating there are remedies for
this overabundance of Technology like
managers limiting the amount of tools
their team members use or guidelines
around which tools best meet the needs
of certain types of work and projects if
you're interested in learning more
listen to the latest episode of our new
podcast Tech at work
